channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Closure of national cycle route without diversion, 17th October
item.description:
The cycle path along Cheltenham road East has been closed without provision of an alternative, safe route. It is adjacent to a very busy route that does not have sufficient width to safely cycle on the carriageway, and in any case there is not a safe crossing suitable for a cyclist traveling South to switch to the other side of the road to carry on their journey. It's used regularly by children cycling to the local secondary schools- this closure puts those children and other cyclist in danger. There is an access path through the adjacent Pirton Fields development, but it is marked as private no through road. I would suggest negotiating with the land owner for access.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham Road East, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road ahead closed sign abandoned, 14th October

item.title: Missing pedestrian crossing control post, 11th October
item.description:
The post that had the button for the pedestrian crossing on it on the corner of Clarence Road & Evesham Road in Cheltenham has disappeared. It may have been damaged in an accident and since removed completely. The crossing can now not be operated from one side of the road. Please can the post with the button be replaced? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Clarence Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
